Wheatley; that should be enough for you to purchase this game!

The sequel to the fantastic Portal doesn't disappoint, sure it's not as quirky as the first but the puzzles and especially the voice acting are just the best.

If you liked the first, what are you reading reviews for? You've already bought this game!
Excelente las voces en castellano.
Insta-buy landmark game. Single and co-op are equally rewarding.

Uno de los dos mejores juegos de puzzles jamÃ¡s creado. El primer Portal fue estupendo pero este mejora en todos los aspectos al original, tanto a nivel de desafios, dificultad, multijugador, cÃ¡maras creadas por la comunidad...
Si te gustan los juegos de rebanarte el coco este es sin duda una opciÃ³n segura.
Â¡Totalmente recomendado!

BONUS: Existe un mod llamado Portal Stories: Mel, se puede encontrar gratuÃ­tamente en Steam si se posee este juego. Se trata de una versiÃ³n con mayor dificultad y nuevos desafÃ­os que se situa antes de los acontecimientos del Portal 2, si te quedas con mÃ¡s ganas de portales y quieres probar una experiencia desafiante recomiendo probarlo. Portal 2 es un juego que se basa en rompecabezas con el uso de portales despues del primer juego en el que te adentra a una Aperture mas deteriorada con el paso del tiempo y en el que intentas escapar...
Es un juego bastante bueno que tiene una historia bastante interesante y con humor en donde estarÃ¡s inmerso tanto en su historia como en sus personajes.

I love this game... It was one of the first steam games I got. Its graphics still stand well to this day and has a great story. everybody should have this game.

Oh boy, Portal 2. A modern classic.
Very solid gameplay, not that much long in Singleplayer.
Has a Co-op mod which can be finished between 2 and... 5 hours, depending how much dumb you and your.. companion is.
The workshop keeps this game very much alive, from single levels to co-op maps & semi total conversion mods.
7 years later and still going strong!

One of the best story-driven games Iâ€™ve played. Some of the games iâ€™ve played tend to be forceful in hints making hints too obvious without effort needed. Both Portal and its sequel Portal 2 are like maths questions. You are taught of the basic formulas, then using those formulas to solve each equation or problem. What makes both games satisfying to finish is that it has the similar experience to the structure where "What you learn now, will help you later" kinda thing. Puzzles can look hard at the surface, but with how the game flows going through each puzzle it can be done at ease. The game's nature is rather calm (most of the time) but the lore... oh the lore. Even after completing both games I can't stop thinking of the lore. The Portal games teaches you as the player to understand the skills you are given and apply it accordingly based on the situation. The process in which you go through analyzing can help you in real life situations. Do spare some time on this game.
